data.title: Backspace
data.statement: Correct the input line for backspaces. With '<' indicating a backspace, however the character '\<' means '<' and not backspace. ('\<' has to be replaced with '<')

testCases.title: Test 4
testCases.testIn: Although the term "backspace" is the traditionalk< name of the key which deletes the character  <to the<e left of the cursor, the actual key may be labeled in A<a variety of ways, for example delete,,< Erase (for example in One Laptop Per Child))<,,< or with a lefgh<<t pointing arrow..<<.<. a<A dedicated symbol for "backspace" exists as U+232b<B but it's<<s use as a keyboard label is not universal. The backspacee< is distinct fro0<m the delete key, which in<n paper media for computers would punch out all the holes to strike-< out a character, and in modern %<computers deletes>< text following it. Also, the delete key often works as a generic command to remove an objects< (such as an image inside a document, or a file in a file &@<<manager)+<, while backspace usually does not?<!<;<:<.
testCases.testOut: Although the term "backspace" is the traditional name of the key which deletes the character to the left of the cursor, the actual key may be labeled in a variety of ways, for example delete, Erase (for example in One Laptop Per Child), or with a left pointing arrow. A dedicated symbol for "backspace" exists as U+232B but its use as a keyboard label is not universal. The backspace is distinct from the delete key, which in paper media for computers would punch out all the holes to strike out a character, and in modern computers deletes text following it. Also, the delete key often works as a generic command to remove an object (such as an image inside a document, or a file in a file manager), while backspace usually does not.

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn: Although the term "backspace" is the traditionalk< name of the key which deletes the character  <to the<e left of the cursor, the actual key may be labeled in A<a variety of ways, for example delete,,< Erase (for example in One Laptop Per Child))<,,< or with a lefgh<<t pointing arrow..<<.<. a<A dedicated symbol for "backspace" exists as U+232b<B but it's<<s use as a keyboard label is not universal. The backspacee< is distinct fro0<m the delete key, which in<n paper media for computers would punch out all the holes to strike-< out a character, and in modern %<computers deletes>< text following it. Also, the delete key often works as a generic command to remove an objects< (such as an image inside a document, or a file in a file &@<<manager)+<, while backspace usually does not?<!<;<:<. < In modern systems, the backspaceE< key is often mapped to the delete character (0x7fF< in ASCII or Unicode)]<,<.<, although the backspace key's function of deleting the cC<haracter befoR<re the cursor remains.[3]<<<<?<.<+<.
testCases.testOut: Although the term "backspace" is the traditional name of the key which deletes the character to the left of the cursor, the actual key may be labeled in a variety of ways, for example delete, Erase (for example in One Laptop Per Child), or with a left pointing arrow. A dedicated symbol for "backspace" exists as U+232B but its use as a keyboard label is not universal. The backspace is distinct from the delete key, which in paper media for computers would punch out all the holes to strike out a character, and in modern computers deletes text following it. Also, the delete key often works as a generic command to remove an object (such as an image inside a document, or a file in a file manager), while backspace usually does not. In modern systems, the backspace key is often mapped to the delete character (0x7f in ASCII or Unicode), although the backspace key's function of deleting the character before the cursor remains.

data.constraints:
1 <= length of [[s]] <= 10000
characters in [[s]] can be all printable ASCII characters

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Correct the input line for backspaces. With '<' indicating a backspace, however the character '\<' means '<' and not backspace. ('\<' has to be replaced with '<')
Input
String s
Output
The input corrected for backspaces.
Constraints
1 <= length of s <= 10000
characters in s can be all printable ASCII characters
Example
Input
abcd<efgh<<ijklmnopqrs<<<tuvwx<yuz<
Output
abcefijklmnoptuvwyu
